page.title: 11Dorset & Salisbury Rlwy.
page.content:
thus preventing any chance of reopening of the original line.Other parts of the track bed are now completely overgrown or(as in the case of the section between Haddons Farm and Bridge Farm)used as farm tracks and access road.Little evidence is now left to indicate its previous use apart from odd peices of railway debris such as ballast,coal and broken track parts which were disgarded over the years.At the saw mill at Three Legged Cross GR078047 two old railway containers are still in use for storage purposes.The line of the railway is still marked by the old fencing.
Since the closure of the railway the area surrounding it has become increasingly more populated,leaving them with no public transport.
